TopicTitle: EVA Satellite repair - My Kerbal Engineer is tethered to satellite after repair

Articles.Content:
Newbie to this game, loving it and learning quite a lot.  Finally got to a level where I could rendezvous with a satellight to interact with it.  The contract is a simple repair, place a solar panel on the thing to "repair" it.  I have tried a couple methods to complete this, but both yield the same "odd" result.  I will preface that I am now familiar with part placement in EVA to a degree that I can take the panel from my ship inventory (or my engineer's inventory) and place it anywhere on my ship.  I can watch the engineer do his laser show and voila, attached.  Even did this with the grabber, moving it from a boom I initially tried to use to the side of my ship.  A side bug I encountered was this weird wobble that would manifest if I extended the boom out perpendicular to my ship's axis of travel, I would use the "control from here" and set SAS to set the final approach.  If the boom was tight into the ship, I would get much less wobble.  If I capture the satellite with the boom extended 90 degrees outwards, the wobble is severe.  Any suggestions for dealing with that would be appreciated.  But the biggest problem I have is with placing a part on the satellite itself.  Rather, what happens after the part is snapped to the body.  The mission progress indicates I have completed the task, all necessary checkmarks there and all I need to do is land and collect the bounty.  Seemed pretty simple and straight forward to me once I saw a tutorial on the process.  So I thought.  I think. 

I had also tried the same thing without physically capturing the satellite, actually that was the first attempt when I matched orbit.  Thinking I did something wrong...aka, I had to capture it...ergo...suffice to say, neither method yielded any different result.  

It does not matter if the part I place on the craft is what is requested, it could be something off my ship like a light for example, I will be then forever locked to that satellite...my Kerbal that is.  I will use the EVA pack to fly back to my ship and the satellite will follow me like a lost puppy, matching every maneuver I make.  I can board my ship again, and try to do a return burn back to Kerbal, and watch that lost puppy follow me.

This behaviour does not happen with my ship.

Is this normal?  Did I need to remove one of the other panels or complete some other task not spelt out in the contract?  There was no indication of which one was damaged, so I just snapped the new one on where the game would let me.  Is this what is tethering me to this lost pup?
Don't know if you're still having this issue but I solved it by just going back to the space center then going back to my kerbal through the tracking station.
